beer.beer_description: Trail Runner was brewed for (and with) our mate Jason from Plumbing Force, his trail running friends, and his daughter & soon-to-be son-in-law. Also coinciding with the launch of our trail running club, Huff & Guzzle, this hazy is a little more bitter than usual and is loaded with Citra & Strata pellets as well as Motueka hop kief.

beer.beer_description: Crafted with meticulous care, this IPA showcases the harmonious blend of two legendary hop varieties: Fuggles and East Kent Goldings. As you pour, a rich amber hue fills the glass, enticing the senses with its warm and inviting appearance. Aromas of earthy hops, delicate floral notes, and a hint of citrus waft through the air, beckoning you to indulge in its enticing bouquet. With the first sip, the full-bodied malt backbone gracefully supports a symphony of hop flavors. Fuggles, renowned for their gentle earthiness, mingle with the subtle spicy and floral character of East Kent Goldings, creating a perfectly balanced palate. The firm bitterness envelopes the taste buds, leaving a lingering, satisfying finish.

Brewed with Citra and Mosaic Cryo and loaded with different fruit terpenes. It smells wonderful, with notes of “Prescribed” Gummies, Mango, Pineapple Lollies, Passionfruit & Peach. It has a solid bitter backbone like an old school IPA, but without the taste. Slick in texture but refreshing. Truly a “fruity wonderland”.

It takes the perfect amount of light, the right framing and a touch of creative love to get the perfect picture of your brew. Now it’s time to drink it! That's 320 check-ins with a photo.  Try 5 more for Level 65!

beer.beer_description: This Red IPA is generously hopped with Strata T90 pellets and Rakau SubZero hop kief. Fire Trail is packed full of dank, earthy character with a full, sweet malt body underneath.

Thanks for staying at home, and checking in with Untappd! It allows us to stay connected to a community of beer lovers, just like you, even if we can't be in the same physical location. From our home to yours, cheers and stay safe!

beer.beer_description: Mango and tropical aromas dominate this experience, with the flavours following in good amount as well. Soft, full-bodied beer with mid-palate sweetness and balancing bitterness at the finish. Good for juicy afternoons and early evenings.

Mango and tropical aromas dominate this experience, with the flavours following in good amount as well. Soft, full-bodied beer with mid-palate sweetness and balancing bitterness at the finish. Good for juicy afternoons and early evenings.

Cloudscapes is a Hazy IPA brewed for the hazy fanatics. We loaded up our whirlpool tun and our fermenter with huge amounts of hops, and sweetened the deal with a lashing of lactose. Sweet, pillowy and juicy, with a mild bitterness still making its presence known.

It's time to celebrate! That's at least 10 birthdays on Untappd. You are in a league of your own!

Everyone loves fresh beer, but obviously not as much as you do. You went straight to the source. 

That's a beer at 100 different venues categorized as a Brewery, Cidery or Meadery. Visit 5 more for Level 21!

beer.beer_description: This beer will sneak up on you if you let it. Deliciously loaded with hops and delivering a West Coast IPA arrangement, in a sessionable ABV hit. A little bit of everything you want, just a bit more responsible.

Keep the party rolling all day long with your favorite low ABV session IPAs. That's 20 different beers with style of IPA - Session. Try 5 more for Level 5!

beer.beer_description:
**Sunspike** by Hiker Brewing Co
Bright and tangy, this blood-orange sour bursts with juicy citrus — freshly-zested blood orange peel mingles with tart, puckering sour notes from the hetero-fermentative yeast Lachancea thermotolerans. A crisp, vibrant body carries the flavour with zip and clarity, while the fruit’s sweet-tart generosity balances the yeast-driven acidity for a refreshingly bold sip.

items.badge_description: Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 135 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 28!
Do you come from the land down under, where beer does flow, and men chunder? That's at least 250 different beers from Australia. Try 5 more for Level 51!

beer.beer_description: A gold-rush of aroma and flavour, this hazy IPA is loaded with the bright tropical punch of El Dorado hops—think pineapple, mango and ripe stone fruit—wrapped in a silky, soft haze body. Pale and juicy, with low bitterness and a pillowy finish, it’s pure treasure in a glass for the hop-seekers among us.

items.badge_description: We believe in IPA and you should too. You certainly have a taste for the hops! That's 150 different IPAs. Try 5 more for Level 31! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

beer.beer_description: Brewed with Citra and Mosaic Cryo and loaded with different fruit terpenes. It smells wonderful, with notes of “Prescribed” Gummies, Mango, Pineapple Lollies, Passionfruit & Peach. It has a solid bitter backbone like an old school IPA, but without the taste. Slick in texture but refreshing. Truly a “fruity wonderland”.

Cloudscapes is a Hazy IPA brewed for the hazy fanatics. We loaded up our whirlpool tun and our fermenter with huge amounts of hops, and sweetened the deal with a lashing of lactose. Sweet, pillowy and juicy, with a mild bitterness still making its presence known.
A hazy for those who want to have a session, or who drew the short straw and are driving home. Loaded with plenty of Citra, Mosaic and Idaho 7; and supported with a touch of lactose.
Bushwalker is an Australian-style Pale Ale which is light in colour, crisp, dry and refreshing. The Aussie hops bring restrained notes of passionfruit and citrus.

Ornith is a re-brew of Red-eared Firetail, which was a fan favourite from Daniel’s gyspy-brewing brand, Ornith. This Red IPA is a big, outgoing, loud, and rather obtrusive beer. Flavours of caramel, dark toffee, citrus, pine, and a little earthiness are contained within this beer. After a few of these beers, you too may be red in the cheeks.
Wee Little is a mid-strength beer, but not as you know it. Think of it as a sessionable version of a Scotch Ale. Light on the palate with a dry finish, but packed full of sweet caramel malt flavour.
Hitchhiker is a West Coast IPA with an assertive bitterness and strong hop flavours of pine and resin. This is all counter-balanced by a sweet malt body, supporting with notes of biscuit and toffee.

Hira Haze is a big, juicy, hazy IPA hopped exclusively with NZ hop varieties. We've used a healthy dose of Nelson Sauvin hop pellets along with both Wakatu and Southern Cross lupulin extracts from our friends at Freestyle Hops. The Nelson gives plenty of juicy stone fruit and grape, while the Wakatu & Southern Cross provide plenty of herbal and grassy notes. This makes for hazy that's a little different to most other tropical fruit salad bombs out there.

Evergreen is a Terpene IPA featuring some resinous dank from Abstrax Hops Pineapple Express. Expect some dank, cannabis and diesel with pineapple, and some orange on the nose. Enhanced but balanced bitterness delivering a journey unique to this beer.

Originally brewed for one of our very close mate's birthday's, Twilight has found a friendly spot in many of our hearts. Fruity hop notes on the nose and deep black in colour, this beer is hiding its best asset in the flavour. Lashings of hop flavour combine thanks to Nelson Sauvin, Idaho 7 and Mosaic, are well supported with roasted notes from the generous use of dark malts. One of our favourite beers for sure!
Toohey Forest is a slightly lighter version of a Dortmunder lager and is a clean, refreshing beer with some lovely sweet, bready malt character.
A thick, luscious oatmeal stout infused with huge amounts of pistachio, while still being approachable. Big roasty coffee notes on the finish.

OUTATIME is a time-traveller from the past. A big old West Coast IPA as a collaboration between Hiker Brewing & White Lies Brewing. We've passed the 88mph by bringing you this 8.8% beer featuring marmalade aromas and flavours, developed from Cashmere, Simcoe, Columbus & Mosaic. Great Scott, what a beer!

Brewed in collaboration with Brisbane Amateur Beer Brewers for GABS 2024, "Don't Take the Pith" is a dessert-style chocolate & orange porter. This creamy, dark, roasty base beer has been infused with orange three ways, as well as cacao nibs and a lashing of lactose.

We’ve brewed a traditional Irish red ale in the lead up to St. Patrick’s Day. Malt dominates this one, with mid-palate full of candy/caramel sweetness and a drying, roasty, coffee-like finish that lures you in for more.

Crafted with meticulous care, this IPA showcases the harmonious blend of two legendary hop varieties: Fuggles and East Kent Goldings. As you pour, a rich amber hue fills the glass, enticing the senses with its warm and inviting appearance. Aromas of earthy hops, delicate floral notes, and a hint of citrus waft through the air, beckoning you to indulge in its enticing bouquet. With the first sip, the full-bodied malt backbone gracefully supports a symphony of hop flavors. Fuggles, renowned for their gentle earthiness, mingle with the subtle spicy and floral character of East Kent Goldings, creating a perfectly balanced palate. The firm bitterness envelopes the taste buds, leaving a lingering, satisfying finish.

This beer will sneak up on you if you let it. Deliciously loaded with hops and delivering a West Coast IPA arrangement, in a sessionable ABV hit. A little bit of everything you want, just a bit more responsible.

Hasta La Vista is a Brut IPA that'll have your taste buds saying, "I'll be back for more!" Brewed with Vista hops, this Terminator 2-inspired concoction pours a golden molten metal hue, and its aroma is a symphony of melon, pear and papaya, like the roar of a Harley. With each sip, it's a liquid cyborg experience—dry, crisp, and refreshingly deadly. The carbonation dances on your palate, a Terminator-strong impression. The finish? Clean, like a time-travel paradox resolved. No lingering bitterness, just a cool, metallic echo. "Hasta La Vista" tells ordinary beers, "Take a hike, baby." So, don your leather jacket, shades, and savor this terminator of a brew. Cheers to a hoppy Judgment Day!

Wilderness is a 100% malt-based Imperial Stout, aged in both Jack Daniel's barrels and American Rye Whiskey barrels, and then blended to taste. Featuring at The Scratch for Weekend of Darkness 2024 and at Newstead Brewing Co for Bungfest 2024.

G'day beer mates! Hiker Brewing Co.'s "Extra Mile," a Leipzig-style Gose, is a ripper with an Aussie twist. Pouring a hazy straw, it's a citrus bomb with lemon myrtle leaf. The tang, like a kookaburra's laugh, is cheeky. The body is light, perfect for a barbie, and the salty hit is like a secret surf break. It finishes crisp, leaving a refreshing taste, ideal for a scorcher. "Extra Mile" is a true-blue choice, taking the classic Gose down under. So, chuck a few tinnies in the esky, gather your mates, and enjoy this fair dinkum brew. Cheers, legends! ?

This exceptional collab with Working Title Brewing is sure to impress. Milk chocolate, coffee and vanilla, with a hint of cinnamon and liquorice flood the senses straight up. The experience transitions through an epic journey of warming spices, a touch of nutmeg and chocolate, with some sweet herbal notes and finishes with just a suggestion of cardamom and clove. The overall impression is that of comfort, a good book by the fire or a month of Fridays at a mates brewery making spice tinctures.

Brewed in collaboration with Hendo & Dan from The Boss & The Brewer Podcast, and with local legends Adam Schell(s). This historical German beer is big and bold. A light brown pour with a huge, chewy malt body and plenty of manuka smoke, then gives way to subtle noble hop notes and Jack Daniels barrel character, plus just a hint of tartness on the finish. This brew features a little bit of everything, while still remaining surprisingly balanced and delicious!

Wanderlust is a German Pilsner brewed with traditional European malt and hops. It's clean, light and bright, but packs a punch with a solid bitterness and plenty of floral, herbal hop aroma & flavour.

Mango and tropical aromas dominate this experience, with the flavours following in good amount as well. Soft, full-bodied beer with mid-palate sweetness and balancing bitterness at the finish. Good for juicy afternoons and early evenings.
A crisp, refreshing and easy drinking midstrength lager, with a firm, pleasant bitterness on the finish.
